newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit gains on stop-loss dollar sales.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit gains on stop-loss dollar sales.

text.p: The ringgit pulled out of its recent range, rising against the dollar on stop-loss dollar sales following heavy buying of the ringgit/Singapore dollar cross, dealers said.
"The sudden rise in the ringgit caught many off guard and there were a lot of dollar sell orders by U.S. funds out of Hong Kong," said a European bank dealer in Kuala Lumpur.
Dealers said some offshore funds could still be net long on the dollar/ringgit, and this was likely to weigh on dollar sentiment.
Buying of the ringgit/Sing cross by U.S. investment houses triggered stop-loss dollar sales around the 2.5140 level.
But corporate dollar demand out of Kuala Lumpur blocked the ringgit's rise around 2.5120.
Dealers said afternoon activity was subdued and the ringgit was now likely to trade in a new range of 2.5100-2.5150 to the dollar. It had traded in the 2.5145-2.5180 range for the past two weeks.
At 1000 GMT, the ringgit was quoted at 2.5138/48 a dollar against 2.5160/70 at the Kuala Lumpur close on Thursday.
